sources.title: Monster from the Ocean Floor (1954) ROGER CORMAN
sources.description:
Produced by: Roger Corman
Directed by: Wyott Ordung
Starring: Anne Kimbell, Stuart Wade, Dick Pinner

When an American on holiday in Mexico learns of a legendary sea monster terrorizing a small fishing village, she teams up with a handsome oceanographer to uncover its origin. 

TRIVIA: This is the movie that launched Roger Corman's career. After working on the set of his scripted Highway Dragnet, he engineered a new model of filmmaking that would earn him the triple crownâ€” King of Bs, King of the Drive-Ins, and King of the Cheese.

metadata.Plot: Swimming near a Mexican village that has been terrorized by a sea monster, Julie Blaie (Anne Kimball), and American artist, is terrified when an object rises to the surface. It turns out to be a one-man submarine piloted by biologist Steve Dunning ('Stuart Wade' (qb)). Later an abalone diver vanishes and Julie faints after seeing the monster's eye rise from the sea. Pablo (Wyott Ordung) and Tula (Inez Palange) plot to offer Julie as a sacrifice to their gods. Pablo deliberately attracts a shark while Juilie is skin-diving, but she escapes, and her line snags an object that Steve and Dr. Baldwin (Dick Pinner) establish as part of a huge sea monster.
metadata.Actors: Anne Kimbell, Stuart Wade, Dick Pinner
